1141376240387067904.text: Because I have heard from so many small employers in Connecticut that are unable to provide coverage to their employees because of the high costs, #Med4America does not require a contribution from these employers.

1141376239703384064.text: #Med4America also allows employers that currently provide gold-level coverage or better to continue to offer those plans. You would also have the option to choose Medicare for America for yourself or your family if they choose not to enroll all employees in the program.

1141376238843551745.text: #Med4America will have no premiums or cost-sharing for any individual or family below 200% of the federal poverty level. For those between 200-600%, premiums & cost-sharing will be on a sliding scale. No one will pay more than 8% of monthly income, and there are no deductibles.

1141376238151507971.text: #Med4America's benefit package ensures that no matter where you live, your zip code does not determine your benefits. If you work for an employer who does not choose Medicare for America, you have the option to choose it for yourself or your family.

1107357897057550336.text: For those below 200% of the Federal Poverty Level, there is absolutely no cost sharing. Zero. For individuals and families between 200% and 600% FPL, premiums are established on a sliding scale, but no one will pay more that 9% of their adjusted monthly gross income.

1107353368262004736.text: There’s much more to say, but thank you for making it this far. We are hard at work making revisions based on feedback, including from some of the comments we’ve seen on Twitter! We’re proud of our vision for #Med4America, and look forward to sharing the new bill soon.

1107353367330897920.text: For primary, mental & behavioral health, the Secretary will increase those reimbursement rates by at least 30%. Why? Individuals on Medicare & Medicaid face tremendous barriers in attaining primary & mental health care. What good is coverage if no doctor in your area takes it?

1107353366546599936.text: Since some things are going to be covered for the first time, the Secretary of HHS will be establishing those rates. #Med4America will be negotiating prescription drug prices, and a quick note, #Med4America has all-payer rate setting.

1107353365120471041.text: Spoiler alert: there will be no deductible when we reintroduce #Med4America. We will have a maximum out of pocket of $3500/$5000 (on a sliding scale). Things exempt from cost-sharing: preventive/chronic disease services, LTSS, and most prescription drugs.

1107353363010805761.text: Beyond adding dental, vision, and hearing, #Med4America includes Long-Term Services and Supports—one the most important benefits we include. No health system is truly universal unless it covers LTSS. Check out Section 2203. #AllMeansAll https://t.co/uurw4Ja2eD

1107353361802760192.text: Many have said Medicaid for all would be better because the benefits covered are better than Medicare. That’s why the #Med4America benefits package is based on Connecticut’s HUSKY. An extensive list ensures that every American has the same strong set of benefits.

1107353360649338880.text: Right now in the U.S., health coverage is determined by zip code. Medicaid and state mandates vary drastically, and if our goal is universal coverage, we can no longer have a system where states decide what benefits to cover.

1107353359521103874.text: #Med4America does allow for employers to provide coverage as long as it is gold level. Far too many employers have become less generous while wages have not increased. Employers can also enroll their employees into #Med4America. Or you as an employee can pick #Med4America

1092186678628892672.text: There's so much more to say about Medicare for America. Looking forward to the robust debate and sharing more about the plan as we (w/ @janschakowsky) get ready to reintroduce it this Congress.

1092186677664202753.text: On employer-sponsored insurance: some people love theirs, others don’t. Our solution: if employers offer gold level coverage, great! If not, they either have to or they can put their employees on #Med4America and make a contribution. And workers can always choose #Med4America.

1092186676653371393.text: It also tackles the Hyde Amendment. Under #Med4America we ensure all reproductive health care is covered. We're also able to end Hyde-like riders for the Indian Health Service, women's veterans healthcare, and health care in ICE detention facilities.

1092186675638386689.text: #Med4America also includes Long-Term Services & Supports as a part of the universal service package. We cannot have a conversation about universal coverage if we do not include robust home and community-based LTSS.

1092186674493382658.text: Like its benefits package. Healthcare should not be determined by your zip code. Unfortunately in our current system it is. #Med4America sets a high threshold for benefits so that all Americans get the same covered benefits and services.

1082834389564829697.text: The federal government plays a key role in people’s everyday lives, and President Trump has selfishly put people’s livelihoods at risk in order to score political points. It is time for President Trump to end his shutdown.

1082834388956733440.text: Hundreds of thousands of federal workers and contractors—many of whom are living paycheck to paycheck—are furloughed or working without pay. Routine food safety inspections have been halted, and the list goes on.
